The main reason why OW1 was criticized was the game mode with mandatory pre-set duties, which ultimately was not enough people to play tank and healer, and this issue has been improved.

But at what cost? It is necessary to mention an invisible cost, that is, the rhythm of the current five-person mode, playing a dozen fast, and now OW2 gives me a feeling of "weakness", and the overall enhancement of T leads me to play C with a strange feeling - it is difficult to kill, and it is also brittle.

I personally see this change in pace as an option that does more good than harm, calling on players to hone their skills, communicate lineups and tactics more. But whether it will bury some hidden problems, we still need to wait and see.



However, I must point out that there are problems in the current OW business model

Relying on players to buy skins to earn profits is not feasible in OW, and the pass cannot be moved forever. Not to mention the ridiculous price of this skin right now.

[h1] I'm Going to be Honest [/h1]

The gameplay itself isnâ€™t awful. Itâ€™s better than the shield shooting simulator that Overwatch 1 had turned into. Besides the occasional frustration that comes from bad matchmaking/questionable balancing decisions; its a fun hero shooter.

The worst part of this game is the shit, piss, and stolen breast milk surrounding it. 

[b]The Community[/b] is a babble of bitching bastards: it legitimately feels as though the dev team is scared to make sweeping changes that could significantly benefit this game because of how volatile this community can be.

[b]The Monetization [/b]is horrendous: Yes skins are generally priced the same amount as other games are but that doesn't mean  they're properly priced.

[b]The Progression[/b] is nonexistent: blizzard saw how hated the "battle-pass-only" progression system in halo infinite was and decided to do that but somehow worse (at least infinite lets you keep and progress bought battle-passes indefinitely). 

On top of all this there's blizzard. Fucking bumbling idiot megacorp blizzard. Blizz has so many horror stories from the past few years of how it has been one of the most toxic work environments in the industry. Sexual harassment, fratboy culture, stealing breast milk from the break room fridge(?????), and more. It was so bad it drove one woman to ACTUAL suicide. Then blizzard has the gaul to turn around and permanently ban players from their game for â€œtoxicityâ€ which most of the time equates to calling the enemy team "trash". Actually fucking despicable.

There is a decent game to be played here, but don't fool yourself; this company is hiding behind a mask of progressive inclusivity and that mask is only there to take as much money from you as possible.

ive played this game on and off since 2016 and it still is less fun than shoving a shotgun down my throat and pulling the trigger. ive never played a more soul sucking game in my whole life. i will be playing tomorrow

i would not wish the overwatch experience on anyone beyond a lol lobbier

Ive been playing Overwatch since ~2018

A lot of the reviews here are negative for good reason. Blizzard essentially promised the community a full fledged PVE experience back in 2019. From then until 2022 we suffered through a content drought, where the devs essentially abandoned the live game in order to work on OW2. We were told constantly that the wait would be worth it in the end, that the product of OW2 would "redefine a sequel". Instead what we got was a fresh coat of paint with all the worst parts of a free to play game. You can read the other reviews for more info that.

People are angry, and rightfully so. I feel like I should be angry too. But theres one problem: the game is too fun.

Every time I play this game I have a good time. The gameplay experience is polished, with characters and settings that clearly have a lot of thought and care put into them. Every hero has their own identity and playstyle that is completely unique to them. You won't find gameplay like this anywhere else. The balance has room for improvement, as always, but ever since role queue was introduced the devs have done a good job of making sure nothing is too OP for too long.
 
When thinking about this game it's really hard not to think about what was promised in 2019, and get angry because this game isn't that. But in my experience, when you let go of that for a moment and look at the game objectively, you realize they've made a really good free to play team shooter with consistent updates and new content every few months.

Everyone can find a character here that they relate to, and either have a great time with friends casually or sweat and climb the ladder. If any of the above appeals to you, I do recommend giving this game a try.

But seriously putting new heroes on the battlepass is so stupid, please stop doing that. It's anti competitive.

I use to loved this game but they've almost completely ruined it now. Iv lost trust in Blizzard and Overwatch. Put so much time into this game and I just don't have interest in playing it unless with friends. There's pretty much no progression, skins that were free now cost money, no way to realistically obtain skins for free, hero balance in this game is actually bad and the only reason it seems good now is because they neglected old Overwatch for 2 years before deleting it to make this mess. They basically pulled a Fall guys and took a really awesome game that was a blast to play for hours on end and just make it a scummy cash grab pile of shit that you could feel stuck into playing because you already invested so much into the game. Most importantly they removed the pve mode of the game which was the entire point of Overwatch 2 and they just scrapped it. The only good thing they've done with this game since it came out was put it on steam. I hate the battle-net launcher and love steam and I think they made a great decision putting it on here and I wish more company's would just put their games on steam because more often then not I go without playing the game because of the different launcher. As of now battle-net was the only other game launcher I had besides steam and now I can finally delete it. Thank you blizzard for this genuinely. Maybe someday they could fix the problems with this game and bring back what made people love the game so much but with blizzard becoming what it is now, My hopes are low.

I think they forgot this game existed and then said "oh dang" Let's pull a Destiny 2!

Played for many years, started in season 8. I played the game at a really high level, peaking rank 127 NA back in overwatch 1, when the game was actually good. Ow2 to me was still a playable game, but it lost soul and depth with the removal of a tank. Now it just felt like an ultra fast passed "brain off" version of its previous self. Despite that, they failed to make the new "game" appeal to casual and competitive players alike. Respect to the people who still believe in ow, but I lost 3 years ago personally. Sad to see. For a completely fresh player, you can probably get on and have some quick fun since it's free, but in terms of long term playability and "a game to stick to" it's not good. The company does not respect the consumers time nor money. Good memories from the good days boys. GG.
